w:r.w:t: will focus on the alphabet and individual letters.
Spelling words will be introduced to the student, and they will soon be able to comprehend the basics of words structure and spelling phonetics.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Say the letters of the alphabet
Know the difference between letters and the alphabet
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning and using
Student should sing with teacher as prompted
Sing this song with the student to begin the lesson with excitement!
If you can, see if the student can sing it by themselves, too!
Have the student say the word “letters” and the sentence, “these are letters.”
You can also have them repeat after you as you explain the different letters.
Circle the whole picture and say the word “Alphabet”
Have the student repeat this word and use it in the sentence, “This is the alphabet”
Sing the first part of the Alphabet Song: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
Sing these letters of the alphabet song and have the student repeat after you
As an extension, repeat the song, slowly, and have student circle the letters
Sing these letters of the alphabet song and have the student repeat after you
As an extension, repeat the song, slowly, and have student circle the letters
Sing the next part of the Alphabet Song:
Sing these letters of the alphabet song and have the student repeat after you
As an extension, repeat the song, slowly, and have student circle the letters
Sing the next part of the Alphabet Song:
Q, R, S, T, U, V
Sing these letters of the alphabet song and have the student repeat after you
As an extension, repeat the song, slowly, and have student circle the letters
Sing the next part of the Alphabet Song:
Sing these letters of the alphabet song and have the student repeat after you
As an extension, repeat the song, slowly, and have student circle the letters
Now I know my ABCs – Next time, won’t you sing with me?
Finish up the song with this line and have the student repeat after you
Sing the complete Alphabet Song with the teacher
Repeat the song, and circling of letters, with the goal of having the child sing the complete song back to you
Circle the letters in the alphabet to spell “cat”
Spell out the word “CAT” with the student.
Circle the letters in the alphabet to spell “
Spell out the word “DOG” with the student
Circle the letters in the alphabet to spell “
Spell out the word “BOY” with the student
Circle the letters in the alphabet to spell “boy”
Spell out the word “GIRL” with the student
Match the sight word to the picture by drawing a l
Help the student spell out the word and draw a line from the word to its corresponding picture.
(Fill in the blank by writing the correct word)
Have the student circle the correct answer to the sentence
As an extension, have the student write the correct word in the blank space
(Fill in the blank by writing the correct word)
Have the student circle the correct answer to the sentence
As an extension, have the student write the correct word in the blank space
Use this slide to explain the difference between “letters” and the entire alphabet.
Sing the song again to close out the lesson and improve the student’s memory of the English alphabet.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Draw some letters on the slide
Show some objects that begin with prompted letters
Use this slide to assist the child in practicing drawing letters.
Display props and ask child to tell which letter it starts with
Ask the child to display an object that begins with a promoted letter
